alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 7:38PM CDT until May 13 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Walsh, Pembina, Marshall and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Grand Forks and Polk Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. .The Red River of the North at Pembina, Drayton, and Oslo continues to recede. Fargo is expected to remain in minor flood stage over the next seven days. River forecasts do incorporate the next 24 hours of forecast precipitation, however additional precipitation is expected outside of this period, including on Saturday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River at Harwood. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 84.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. Actions taken to completely seal the flood barrier. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 84.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CDT Thursday was 84.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 80.7 feet around next Thursday. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
